benchmark_details.name: ReEval
benchmark_details.overview: ReEval is an LLM-based framework designed for automatically generating dynamic evaluation datasets to assess the reliability of retrieval-augmented language models (LLMs) in handling new evidence, specifically targeting hallucination issues arising from static question-answering data.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a reliable framework for evaluating the faithfulness and reliability of retrieval-augmented LLMs against hallucination issues.
audience: Researchers in AI and machine learning
tasks: Evaluating LLMs' responses to dynamically generated adversarial examples
Investigating model reliability in context-based answering
out_of_scope_uses: Complex reasoning tasks requiring multi-hop answers

data.size: 7189 instances from NQ and 1380 instances from RealtimeQA

methods: Dynamic data generation through evidence perturbation
methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model outputs against reference answers.
methodology.interpretation: Evaluation of model responses is interpreted to assess compliance with provided supporting evidence.
methodology.validation: Results validated through human judgments for generated evidence.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Generated data does not involve personal data.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Public datasets used are based on existing open-access resources.
